blocks.content: Fineness is a relation. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 28-Sep-2009.)

blocks.name: isfne
blocks.content: The predicate " ` B ` is finer than ` A ` ". This property is, in a sense, the opposite of refinement, as refinement requires every element to be a subset of an element of the original and fineness requires that every element of the original have a subset in the finer cover containing every point. I do not know of a literature reference for this. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 28-Sep-2009.)

  -| wceq(c3, cuni(c2))

  uniexg(c0, c1)

  brabg(hs0, hs1, c2, universe, c0, c1, cfne, wa(wceq(c3, c4), wral(s0, c2, wss(cv(s0), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0))))))), wa(wceq(cuni(cv(hs0)), cuni(cv(hs1))), wral(s0, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cuni(cin(cv(hs1), cpw(cv(s0))))))), wa(wceq(c3, cuni(cv(hs1))), wral(s0, c2, wss(cv(s0), cuni(cin(cv(hs1), cpw(cv(s0))))))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cuni(cv(hs0)), cuni(cv(hs1))), wral(s0, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cuni(cin(cv(hs1), cpw(cv(s0)))))), wceq(c3, cuni(cv(hs1))), wral(s0, c2, wss(cv(s0), cuni(cin(cv(hs1), cpw(cv(s0)))))))
  eqeq1d(cuni(cv(hs0)), cuni(cv(hs1)), c3, wceq(cv(hs0), c2))
  syl6eqr(cuni(cv(hs0)), c3, cuni(c2), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c2)
  raleq(s0, cv(hs0), c2, wss(cv(s0), cuni(cin(cv(hs1), cpw(cv(s0))))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(c3, cuni(cv(hs1))), wral(s0, c2, wss(cv(s0), cuni(cin(cv(hs1), cpw(cv(s0)))))), wceq(c3, c4), wral(s0, c2, wss(cv(s0), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0)))))))

blocks.name: isfne4
blocks.content: The predicate " ` B ` is finer than ` A ` " in terms of the topology generation function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm isfne4(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wb(wbr(c0, cfne, c1), wa(wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1))))
  -| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cuni(c1))
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wbr(c0, cfne, c1), wa(wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1))), wcel(c1, universe))
  brrelex2i(c0, cfne, c1)
  fnerel()
  sylibr(wa(wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1))), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cuni(c1), universe))
  eqeltrrd(cuni(c1), universe, cuni(c0), wa(wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1))))
  3eqtr3g(cuni(c0), cuni(c1), c2, c3, wa(wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1))))
  simpl(wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1)))
  sylib(wa(wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1))), wcel(cuni(c0), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  adantl(wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1)), wcel(c0, universe))
  ssex(c0, cfv(ctg, c1))
  fvex(ctg, c1)
  uniexb(c0)
  uniexb(c1)
  bitr4d(wcel(c1, universe), wbr(c0, cfne, c1), wa(wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1))), wa(wceq(c2, c3), wral(hs0, c0, wss(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(c1, cpw(cv(hs0))))))))
  isfne(hs0, c1, universe, c0, c2, c3)
  anbi2d(wcel(c1, universe), wceq(c2, c3), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1)), wral(hs0, c0, wss(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(c1, cpw(cv(hs0)))))))
  syl5bb(wcel(c1, universe), wss(c0, cfv(ctg, c1)), wral(hs0, c0, wss(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(c1, cpw(cv(hs0)))))), wral(hs0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c1))))
  dfss3(hs0, c0, cfv(ctg, c1))
  ralbidv(hs0, c0, wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c1)), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(c1, cpw(cv(hs0))))))
  eltg(c1, universe, cv(hs0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(ctg, c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c1, universe))
}

thm isfne4(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  âŠ¢ (c0[Fne]c1 â†”(c2 = c3 âˆ§ c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1)))
  âŠ£ c2 = â‹ƒ c0
  âŠ£ c3 = â‹ƒ c1
} = {
  pm5.21nii(c0[Fne]c1, (c2 = c3 âˆ§ c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1)), c1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  brrelex2i(c0, cfne, c1)
  fnerel()
  sylibr((c2 = c3 âˆ§ c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1)), c1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, â‹ƒ c1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  eqeltrrd(â‹ƒ c1, universe, â‹ƒ c0, (c2 = c3 âˆ§ c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1)))
  3eqtr3g(â‹ƒ c0, â‹ƒ c1, c2, c3, (c2 = c3 âˆ§ c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1)))
  simpl(c2 = c3, c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1))
  sylib((c2 = c3 âˆ§ c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1)), â‹ƒ c0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, c0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  adantl(c2 = c3, c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1), c0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  ssex(c0, (topGen ` c1))
  fvex(ctg, c1)
  uniexb(c0)
  uniexb(c1)
  bitr4d(c1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, c0[Fne]c1, (c2 = c3 âˆ§ c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1)), (c2 = c3 âˆ§ âˆ€(hs0 âˆˆ c0, hs0 âŠ† â‹ƒ(c1 â‹‚ P(hs0)))))
  isfne(hs0, c1, universe, c0, c2, c3)
  anbi2d(c1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, c2 = c3, c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1), âˆ€(hs0 âˆˆ c0, hs0 âŠ† â‹ƒ(c1 â‹‚ P(hs0))))
  syl5bb(c1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, c0 âŠ†(topGen ` c1), âˆ€(hs0 âˆˆ c0, hs0 âŠ† â‹ƒ(c1 â‹‚ P(hs0))), âˆ€(hs0 âˆˆ c0, hs0 âˆˆ(topGen ` c1)))
  dfss3(hs0, c0, (topGen ` c1))
  ralbidv(hs0, c0, c1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, hs0 âˆˆ(topGen ` c1), hs0 âŠ† â‹ƒ(c1 â‹‚ P(hs0)))
  eltg(c1, universe, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((topGen ` c1))
  diff.hs0.w(c1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
}

blocks.name: isfne4b
blocks.content: A condition for a topology to be finer than another. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 28-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm isfne4b(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wbr(c2, cfne, c0), wa(wceq(c3, c4), wss(cfv(ctg, c2), cfv(ctg, c0)))))
  -| wceq(c3, cuni(c2))
  -| wceq(c4, cuni(c0))
} = {
  syl6rbbr(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c2, cfne, c0), wa(wceq(c3, c4), wss(cfv(ctg, c2), cfv(ctg, c0))), wa(wceq(c3, c4), wss(c2, cfv(ctg, c0))))
  pm5.32da(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c4), wss(cfv(ctg, c2), cfv(ctg, c0)), wss(c2, cfv(ctg, c0)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c4)), wb(wss(cfv(ctg, c2), cfv(ctg, c0)), wss(c2, cfv(ctg, c0))), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, c1))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c4)), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(cuni(c2), universe))
  eqeltrd(cuni(c2), universe, cuni(c0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c4)))
  3eqtr3g(cuni(c2), cuni(c0), c3, c4, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c4)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c4))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c4), wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
  uniexg(c0, c1)
  uniexb(c2)
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c4))
  tgss3(c2, universe, c0, c1)
  isfne4(c2, c0, c3, c4)
}

thm isfne4b(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  âŠ¢ (c0 âˆˆ c1 â†’(c2[Fne]c0 â†”(c3 = c4 âˆ§(topGen ` c2)âŠ†(topGen ` c0))))
  âŠ£ c3 = â‹ƒ c2
  âŠ£ c4 = â‹ƒ c0
} = {
  syl6rbbr(c0 âˆˆ c1, c2[Fne]c0, (c3 = c4 âˆ§(topGen ` c2)âŠ†(topGen ` c0)), (c3 = c4 âˆ§ c2 âŠ†(topGen ` c0)))
  pm5.32da(c0 âˆˆ c1, c3 = c4, (topGen ` c2)âŠ†(topGen ` c0), c2 âŠ†(topGen ` c0))
  syl2anc((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c3 = c4), ((topGen ` c2)âŠ†(topGen ` c0)â†” c2 âŠ†(topGen ` c0)), c2 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, c0 âˆˆ c1)
  sylibr((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c3 = c4), c2 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, â‹ƒ c2 âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  eqeltrd(â‹ƒ c2, universe, â‹ƒ c0, (c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c3 = c4))
  3eqtr3g(â‹ƒ c2, â‹ƒ c0, c3, c4, (c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c3 = c4))
  simpr(c0 âˆˆ c1, c3 = c4)
  adantr(c0 âˆˆ c1, c3 = c4, â‹ƒ c0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  uniexg(c0, c1)
  uniexb(c2)
  simpl(c0 âˆˆ c1, c3 = c4)

  isfne4(c2, c0, c3, c4)
}

thm isfne2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wbr(c2, cfne, c0), wa(wceq(c3, c4), wral(s0, c2, wral(s1, cv(s0), wrex(s2, c0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wss(cv(s2), cv(s0)))))))))

blocks.name: fnebas
blocks.content: A finer cover covers the same set as the original. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 28-Sep-2009.)

blocks.name: fnetg
blocks.content: A finer cover generates a topology finer than the original set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: fnessex
blocks.content: If ` B ` is finer than ` A ` and ` S ` is an element of ` A ` , every point in ` S ` is an element of a subset of ` S ` which is in ` B ` . (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 28-Sep-2009.)

blocks.name: fneuni
blocks.content: If ` B ` is finer than ` A ` , every element of ` A ` is a union of elements of ` B ` . (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 11-Oct-2009.)

  el2v(hs0, hs1, wb(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1)), wceq(cfv(ctg, cv(hs0)), cfv(ctg, cv(hs1)))))
  fneval(cv(hs0), universe, cv(hs1), universe, c0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)

  diff.hs1.c(cfv(ctg, cv(hs0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: topfne

blocks.name: refssfne
blocks.content: A cover is a refinement iff it is a subcover of something which is both finer and a refinement. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 18-Jan-2010.) (Revised by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Feb-2020.)
